name: Reschedule Internal Meeting
description: Remote administrative assistant has a scheduling conflict and needs to reschedule an internal meeting in a professional way.
student_task: You are a remote administrative assistant. Your department manager Michael Johns sent a reminder about a team check-in, but you realize you have another important call at the same time. Reply to Michael's email. Apologize briefly, explain the conflict simply, suggest 1â€“2 new times for the meeting, and confirm that you still care about the topic. Use polite, simple English.
counterpart_style: You are a department manager who understands that schedules can change but dislikes last-minute surprises. You appreciate when people bring solutions, not just problems.
grading_focus: Focus on whether the student clearly explains the conflict, suggests new times, keeps the message polite and short, and shows that they are still engaged with the work.
starter_email_body:
Hi {student_name},

Just a reminder that we have our weekly check-in tomorrow at 10:00 AM. We'll be going over project updates and the Q2 priorities list.

Please come prepared with a quick summary of where things stand on your end. I'd like to keep it to 30 minutes.

See you then,
Michael
starter_email_generation_hint: Write a brief reminder email from the manager confirming a team check-in time and expecting everyone to attend.
